pr_title: Allow APIs to return metadata and state of artifacts in DISABLED state

timeline.bodyText: I'm not 100% sure about this.  There's no concept of "state" in the ccompat API, right?  And the entire schema is available (obviously) from the schema property of the result.  It seems like maybe this should return a 404?
timeline.author: EricWittmann

replies.bodyText: I wasn't sure about that either. You're right that the ccompat API doesn't have state, so I have updated to return a 404 when users GET a disabled artifact on the /ccompat/subjects/{subject}/versions/{version} endpoint.
replies.author: ajborley

timeline.message:
Allow APIs to return metadata and state of artifacts in DISABLED state

- This commit updates the list of active states to include DISABLED,
meaning that API calls for artifacts that have been set to the DISABLED
state no longer return 404 responses on the /meta and /state
endpoints.
- It also updates the following endpoints to return 404 when the
artifact is in DISABLED state, so that behaviour remains the same for
the endpoints that return only the artifact content.
  - `GET /api/artifacts/{artifactid}`
  - `GET /api/artifacts/{artifactid}/versions/{version}`
  - `GET /api/ids/{globalid`
  - `GET /api/ccompat/subjects/{subjectid}/versions/{version}/schema`

Signed-off-by: Andrew Borley <borley@uk.ibm.com>
